lead_paragraph: Frustrated by thieves stealing personal data from millions of customers, banks are investing in biometric technology to offer better security.

headline.print_headline: Bye, Password. Now a Fingertip Gets Clients In.
headline.main: Goodbye, Password. Banks Opt to Scan Fingers and Faces Instead.

snippet: Frustrated by thieves stealing personal data from millions of customers, banks are investing in biometric technology to offer better security.
abstract: Some of largest banks in United States have embraced biometrics--fingerprints, facial scans and voice recognition--to better safeguard customers' accounts; many of these features only work when used on specific smartphone that belongs to bank account holder, adding extra layer of protection; shift in part reflects worry that traditional passwords are now less effective because so much personal information has fallen into hands of online criminals.
